reviewText:
Snake Blocks features such great positive reinforcement that I almost feel like I should give the game a positive review based on just that!

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=608149037

The game starts relatively simple and includes a tutorial to show you how to play the game and how to use the game's camera control which I personally am not a fan of but it doesn't ruin any form of the game for me. You simply have to drag the snakes to the position the game requires within the length of the snake. The more snakes that are involved, the trickier this gets as you need to prioritise getting shorter snakes to the goal first.
voteText: 8 of 8 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Snake blocks ruined Christmas :( I was playing it too long and I forgot to make the fruit salad and my mother yelled at me :(

Snake blocks filled the void that the app flow left in my heart. It's really addicting and pleasant to look at. It's also the right balance of challenging and relaxing. I curse at the game just enough to feel like I'm working my brain, but not enough to feel constantly frustrated. Overall it's a really decent puzzle game to pass the time, and if you need a neutral/positive distraction from anxiety or stressful situations, it could really help.

Usually I'd rather play this kind of game online for free, but I think it's worth buying because you can tell that a lot of attention and personality went into the game and it's nice to support indie developers.

reviewText:
This Game is simple and fun.
Pros :
> The music is good and relaxing
> The design is really nice
> Level editor is very easy to use, too

Suggestions (i don't know if this game will be updated, but ill write stuff i think it would be cool in the game anyways)
> Be able to custom blocks in level editor(like coloring a block with a color or even drawing something in it), so it would be possible to create pixel art levels
> Larger levels (i fell like 5x5 is not big enough), 9x9 (or more) levels would be nice
> Be able to create levels with more than five snakes (at least with 6 snakes) in level editor
I recommend this game for everyone :D

Snake Blocks is a great puzzle game - using the basic concept of Flow and making it 3D. The puzzles begin simple but ramp up in difficulty. Some of the 4 and 5-snake puzzles were really tough to solve and I enjoyed the challenge. The art and music are perfect for this type of game - clean, colorful, and not distracting.

Though I haven't used it much, I imagine that the puzzle creator could easily extend the playtime of this game to several hours.

Overall, I'm pretty happy with Snake Blocks. For a game under $5, it's a nice change of pace.
snakes. blocks. my two favorite things in life combined in one beautifully crafted game. at times i found myself thinking man
date: this game would really be the ♥♥♥♥ if i had a few more snakes and a few more blocks"
helpfulPercent: more puzzle fun. definitely an enjoyable experience from start to finish!"

reviewText: I like the puzzles, but the game is so short (less than 3 hours) and the controls are so bad that it's really hard for me to recommend it unless you catch it on sale.\n\nTo clarify on the controls, your camera is locked to isometric angles (sometimes your snake is obstructed from all isometric angles, though at least you can still drag its head if you know where it is behind obstructions), and clicking and dragging in 3D space is REALLY awkward.  Your snake will often go in unintended directions because the tolerance between them is wonky, and then when you try to back it up it'll go loop around some more.

reviewText:
Actually I thought It might be 3D Flow(https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.bigduckgames.flow&hl=ko) when I saw thimbnail images of the game.
Graphic, Music, Sound Effect were good. But the Puzzle was so boring and easy.
Level design was failure(Is it rude expression?). It should be adjusted step by step.
Camera angle(View) was't switched  that I thought. That's really uncomfortable to move snake blocks.
I ask developer to make keyboard manual. Like Diagonal driection" key or "Confirm to Place block" key or "Change checked color blocks to transparent(see-through)"key. Click&drag is so comfortable manual but easy to misplace frequently.

Probably I wouldn't recommend this game until fixing those few problems."

reviewText:
Before I start off I like to state that I've been waiting for a sale for this game since day 1. Here it is and now I get to play it! How was it? at first impression, disappointing :(



It's a good idea. I'll say that, but it has a few problems (which will hopefully be fixed by the time you're reading this). Starting off, mouse acceleration. This is a terrible thing for a puzzle game like this. And even if technically there is no actual mouse acc in this game, then the sensitivity or something, is screwed. The next flaw is MAJOR. From what I know (which is nothing) the levels you can create can be only played by you. That means the level editor is pretty much non-existant!!! However I'm not sure on this one and am waiting for a response from the dev about how the level editor works. However this game isn't ALL bad, I mean the gameplay is actually quite unique and it is actually pretty damn fun. I also like the easy access of the level editor and the unique visuals of the game. Oh, and yes. you will scratch your head numerous times while playing this game!

6/10 Fun gameplay but not without some flaws

Pros:
-Unique visuals
-Fun gameplay
-Challenging
-Easy-to-use level-editor

Cons:
-Weird mouse acceleration
-Confusing level-editor

reviewText: Balanced difficulty curve. Well designed puzzles. Solid visual design. Great music. Wish the camera allowed for more free movement on certain levels. A perfect candidate for steam workshop support for community made levels imo.
